pr_title: [risk=medium][RW-5471][RW-5472] List workspace files on admin page

timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: alt: include this (and also cloudStorageTraffic?) in the WorkspaceAdminView
timeline.author: jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1720,6 +1720,21 @@ paths:
           description: HTML Read Only version of the notebook
           schema:
             "$ref": "#/definitions/ReadOnlyNotebookResponse"
+  "/v1/admin/workspaces/{workspaceNamespace}/files":

replies.bodyText: I think I like what you've done here with splitting it out. In the future, if we need to paginate this endpoint we'll have the flexibility to do so.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: changed this text to be more precise.  See the comments at https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-5471
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: FYI: Technically there is a middle-ground, which are notebooks in subdirs of notebooks/. These are synchronized back/forth to the notebook VM/GCS, but are not displayed on the RW notebooks list page. Way too much detail for this line, and I don't think I would change the description you have here.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.message: List workspace files on admin page
restyle workspaceInfoField and reword a few entries

timeline.bodyText: unused here.  useful for the other test, so I moved it there.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: These 3 lines copied from some other DataTable.  I can remove/adjust if inappropriate here.
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText:
It's worth noting that the implementation for getBlobList is flawed - it only returns the first page of results. This is probably acceptable for your use case here, though it would be ideal to communicate whether there are more files or not back to the admin page. I think it will present more of a problem for us on the admin page - more so than on the user-facing page, since people may have a large number of object files living outside of the main notebooks/ directory.
Do you mind adding a disclaimer to this method? Ideally the admin method would also communicate storage.get(bucketName).list().hasNextPage() back to the client.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: whoa - I was not aware, thanks.  Is there a getBlobList ticket?  We should probably address this more generally.  Maybe with new names as a first step - getFirst100Blobs maybe?
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: I don't think there's a ticket - I just noticed this when I looked at the implementation during review. I fixed one similar issue around cloning a while back, but forgot to check this.
replies.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: And yea - updating the name make sense. I highly doubt the current behavior was intentional, devs often miss that these list APIs are (of course), paginated.
replies.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: Welp.  It's crappy but it's honest.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Added a bunch of Javadoc and code comments as well.  I'll file a ticket to come back to this.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText:
Really nice solution, thank you. Could you apply this to the total on L304 as well?
This also satisfies the AC on https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-5472 , so please close that with this PR as well - if you don't mind.
timeline.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText:
Current approach incorrectly handles this input:
parseLocation({... 'gs://bkt/foo/bar/foo'}) -> 'gs://bkt/bar/foo'

Probably substring() is best here; regexp is a bit dicey since the prefix/suffix are ultimately user input.
timeline.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: replace replaces the first instance, so if the filename is duplicated in the path this approach fails
replies.author: calbach

timeline.message: convert workspaceInfoField to a functional component
Split getBlobList/ForPrefix into Iterable and Page versions
